official-title.#text:
To establish the Santa Cruz Valley National Heritage
		  Area, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Santa Cruz Valley National Heritage Area
			 Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
The table of contents of this Act is as follows:

toc-entry.#text: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.

Sec. 4. Designation of Santa Cruz Valley National Heritage
				Area.
Sec. 8. Relationship to other Federal agencies.

Sec. 9. Private property and regulatory
				protections.
Sec. 11. Use of Federal funds from other sources.
Sec. 12. Sunset for grants and other assistance.

text.#text: The purposes of this Act include—

to establish the
			 Santa Cruz Valley National Heritage Area in the State of Arizona;

quote.#tail:
study completed by the National Park Service in 1991, and
			 the
quote.#text:
Alternative Concepts for Commemorating Spanish
			 Colonization

quote.#tail: prepared by the Center for Desert Archaeology in July 2005;
quote.#text:
Feasibility Study for the Santa Cruz Valley National Heritage
			 Area

text.#text:
to implement the
			 recommendations of the

to provide a
			 management framework to foster a close working relationship with all levels of
			 government, the private sector, and the local communities in the region and to
			 conserve the region’s heritage while continuing to pursue compatible economic
			 opportunities;

to assist
			 communities, organizations, and citizens in the State of Arizona in
			 identifying, preserving, interpreting, and developing the historical, cultural,
			 scenic, and natural resources of the region for the educational and
			 inspirational benefit of current and future generations; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and communities,
			 governments, and organizations within the National Heritage Area.

text.#text:
to provide
			 appropriate linkages between units of the
In this Act:

term.#tail:
means
			 the Santa Cruz Valley National Heritage Area established in this Act.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail:
means the Santa Cruz Valley Heritage Alliance, Inc., which is
			 hereby designated by Congress—

text.#text: The term

to act as a
			 catalyst for the implementation of projects and programs among diverse partners
			 in the National Heritage Area.

term.#tail:
means the plan
			 prepared by the local coordinating entity for the National Heritage Area that
			 specifies actions, policies, strategies, performance goals, and recommendations
			 to meet the goals of the National Heritage Area, in accordance with this
			 Act.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means the Secretary of the Interior.

text.#text:
The
			 term

header.#text:
Designation of
			 Santa Cruz Valley National Heritage Area

text.#text:
There
			 is hereby established the Santa Cruz Valley National Heritage Area.

The National Heritage Area shall consist of portions of
			 the counties of Santa Cruz and Pima.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the local coordinating entity.

quote.#tail:
, and numbered T09/80,000, and dated November 13,
			 2007. The map shall be on file and available to the public in the appropriate
			 offices of the
quote.#text:
Santa Cruz Valley
			 National Heritage Area

text.#text:
The boundaries of the National Heritage
			 Area shall be as generally depicted on the map titled

The
			 management plan for the National Heritage Area shall—

describe
			 comprehensive policies, goals, strategies, and recommendations for telling the
			 story of the heritage of the area covered by the National Heritage Area and
			 encouraging long-term resource protection, enhancement, interpretation,
			 funding, management, and development of the National Heritage Area;

include a
			 description of actions and commitments that Federal, State, Tribal, and local
			 governments, private organizations, and citizens will take to protect, enhance,
			 interpret, fund, manage, and develop the natural, historical, cultural,
			 educational, scenic, and recreational resources of the National Heritage
			 Area;

specify existing
			 and potential sources of funding or economic development strategies to protect,
			 enhance, interpret, fund, manage, and develop the National Heritage
			 Area;

include an
			 inventory of the natural, historical, cultural, educational, scenic, and
			 recreational resources of the National Heritage Area related to the national
			 importance and themes of the National Heritage Area that should be protected,
			 enhanced, interpreted, managed, funded, and developed;

recommend policies
			 and strategies for resource management, including the development of
			 intergovernmental and interagency agreements to protect, enhance, interpret,
			 fund, manage, and develop the natural, historical, cultural, educational,
			 scenic, and recreational resources of the National Heritage Area;

describe a program
			 for implementation for the management plan, including—

performance
			 goals;

specific
			 commitments for implementation that have been made by the local coordinating
			 entity or any Federal, State, Tribal, or local government agency, organization,
			 business, or individual;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and other Federal agencies associated with the National Heritage
			 Area) to further the purposes of this Act; and

text.#text:
include an
			 analysis of, and recommendations for, means by which Federal, State, Tribal,
			 and local programs may best be coordinated (including the role of the

include a business
			 plan that—

describes the
			 role, operation, financing, and functions of the local coordinating entity and
			 of each of the major activities contained in the management plan; and

provides adequate
			 assurances that the local coordinating entity has the partnerships and
			 financial and other resources necessary to implement the management plan for
			 the National Heritage Area.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for approval.

Not later than 3 years after the date on which funds are
			 first made available to develop the management plan after designation as a
			 National Heritage Area, the local coordinating entity shall submit the
			 management plan to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in accordance with

, the local coordinating entity shall not
			 qualify for any additional financial assistance under this Act until such time
			 as the management plan is submitted to and approved by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Santa Cruz Valley National Heritage Area Act/s:5/ss:b/p:1

text.#text:
Not
			 later than 180 days after receiving the plan, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall consult with the Governor of each State in which the National
			 Heritage Area is located before approving a management plan for the National
			 Heritage Area.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall consider whether—

text.#text:
In determining whether to approve a management plan for
			 a National Heritage Area, the

the local
			 coordinating entity represents the diverse interests of the National Heritage
			 Area, including Federal, State, Tribal, and local governments, natural and
			 historic resource protection organizations, educational institutions,
			 businesses, recreational organizations, community residents, and private
			 property owners;

the local
			 coordinating entity—

has
			 afforded adequate opportunity for public and Federal, State, Tribal, and local
			 governmental involvement (including through workshops and hearings) in the
			 preparation of the management plan; and

the resource
			 protection, enhancement, interpretation, funding, management, and development
			 strategies described in the management plan, if implemented, would adequately
			 protect, enhance, interpret, fund, manage, and develop the natural, historic,
			 cultural, educational, scenic, and recreational resources of the National
			 Heritage Area;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
has
			 received adequate assurances from the appropriate State, Tribal, and local
			 officials whose support is needed to ensure the effective implementation of the
			 State, Tribal, and local elements of the management plan; and

the management
			 plan demonstrates partnerships among the local coordinating entity, Federal,
			 State, Tribal, and local governments, regional planning organizations,
			 nonprofit organizations, or private sector parties for implementation of the
			 management plan.

may
			 make recommendations to the local coordinating entity for revisions to the

text.#text:
Based
			 on the evaluation conducted under

To
			 further the purposes of the National Heritage Area, the Santa Cruz Valley
			 Heritage Alliance, Inc., as the local coordinating entity, shall—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in accordance with this Act;

text.#text:
prepare a
			 management plan for the National Heritage Area, and submit the management plan
			 to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for each fiscal year for which the local coordinating
			 entity receives Federal funds under this Act, specifying—

text.#text:
submit an annual
			 report to the

the specific
			 performance goals and accomplishments of the local coordinating entity;

the expenses and
			 income of the local coordinating entity;

the amounts and
			 sources of matching funds;

the amounts
			 leveraged with Federal funds and sources of the leveraging; and

grants made to any
			 other entities during the fiscal year;

make available for
			 audit for each fiscal year for which the local coordinating entity receives
			 Federal funds under this Act, all information pertaining to the expenditure of
			 the funds and any matching funds; and

encourage economic
			 viability and sustainability that is consistent with the purposes of the
			 National Heritage Area.

For
			 the purposes of preparing and implementing the approved management plan for the
			 National Heritage Area, the local coordinating entity may use Federal funds
			 made available under this Act to—

enter into
			 cooperative agreements with or provide technical assistance to political
			 jurisdictions, nonprofit organizations, Federal agencies, and other interested
			 parties;

hire and
			 compensate staff, including individuals with expertise in—

economic and
			 community development; and

heritage
			 planning;

obtain funds or
			 services from any source, including other Federal programs;

contract for goods
			 or services; and

support activities
			 of partners and any other activities that further the purposes of the National
			 Heritage Area and are consistent with the approved management plan.

The local coordinating entity may
			 not use Federal funds authorized under this Act to acquire any interest in real
			 property.

header.#text:
Prohibition on
			 acquisition of real property

text.#text:
Nothing in this Act affects the authority of a Federal
			 agency to provide technical or financial assistance under any other law.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and the local
			 coordinating entity to the maximum extent practicable.

text.#text:
The head of any Federal agency planning to conduct
			 activities that may have an impact on a National Heritage Area is encouraged to
			 consult and coordinate the activities with the
Nothing in this Act—

limits the
			 discretion of a Federal land manager to implement an approved land use plan
			 within the boundaries of a National Heritage Area; or

modifies, alters,
			 or amends any authorized use of Federal land under the jurisdiction of a
			 Federal agency.
Nothing in this Act—

abridges the
			 rights of any property owner (whether public or private), including the right
			 to refrain from participating in any plan, project, program, or activity
			 conducted within the National Heritage Area;

alters any duly
			 adopted land use regulation, approved land use plan, or other regulatory
			 authority of any Federal, State, Tribal, or local agency, or conveys any land
			 use or other regulatory authority to any local coordinating entity, including
			 but not necessarily limited to development and management of energy, water, or
			 water-related infrastructure;

authorizes or
			 implies the reservation or appropriation of water or water rights;

diminishes the
			 authority of the State to manage fish and wildlife, including the regulation of
			 fishing and hunting within the National Heritage Area; or

creates any
			 liability, or affects any liability under any other law, of any private
			 property owner with respect to any person injured on the private
			 property.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, there are authorized to
			 be appropriated
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Santa Cruz Valley National Heritage Area Act/s:10/ss:b
Santa Cruz Valley National Heritage Area Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#tail: . Funds so appropriated shall remain available until expended.

text.#text:
Not more than $15,000,000 may be
			 appropriated to carry out this Act.

The Federal share of the total cost of any activity
			 under this Act shall be not more than 50 percent; the non-Federal contribution
			 may be in the form of in-kind contributions of goods or services fairly
			 valued.

Nothing in this Act shall preclude the local
			 coordinating entity from using Federal funds available under other laws for the
			 purposes for which those funds were authorized.

header.#text:
Use of Federal
			 funds from other sources

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to provide
			 financial assistance under this Act terminates on the date that is 15 years
			 after the date of enactment of this Act.
